newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India lifted by local rally, waits SBI.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India lifted by local rally, waits SBI.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) were lifted by a rally on the local market after a two day holiday for the Bombay Stock Exchange.
"Sentiment improved on the back of the local market, we are waiting for news on State Bank of India which roadshows in London next week," said a trader.
New issues news was mixed, with the Indian Finance Ministry approving a $500 million issue from State Bank of India and the cancellation of a $80 million issue from Gujarat State Fertilizer Co.
SBI's underlying stock was pushed 18.10 rupees higher to 272.10 rupees.

Indian overseas telecommunications monopoly VSNL was also planning a GDR issue of up to $800 million, led by Salomon, but this was mired in a political scandal surround the arrest of former telecommunications minister Sukh Ram and the timing of the issue remained clouded.

The James Capel Indian GDR Index rose 1.7 points, or 2.45 percent to 70.88 points, a premium of 13.86 percent over the local market after the Bombay Stock Exchange 30 Share Index rose 66.64 points, 1.99 percent, to 3414.01.
Tata Engineering followed gains on the local market, with the GDR up 81 cents to $13.75/$14.75 after a 28.25 rupee rise to 480.75.
The National Stock Exchange (NSE) index gained 23 points or 2.37 percent up at 994 points.
The Capel Index is below the 71.53 level of the start of this year and the 86.80 points three months ago.

Activity elsewhere in Asia was subdued, as the Capel Taiwan Index rose 0.21 points, 0.21 percent, to 89.89 points a premium of 3.84 percent over the local market after the Taiwan Weighted Index gained 20.58 points to 6,499.02.
The Capel Korea Index fell 0.48 points 0.71 percent to 67.46 points, a premium of 26.11 percent over the local market after the Korea Composite Index rose 0.35 points to a provisional 782.12.
